Modeling R
0 using projected climate data . An ensemble of modeled temperature data available from three regional climate model (RCM) and two global climate model (GCM) runs were used to estimate future changes in R 0 (see Supplemental Material, “Validation of climate model output,” pp. 11–14; Table S3). We extracted time series of daily temperature for the 30 Canadian sites from each model. Simulated temperature at a given site was defined as the mean of the closest grid values to that site, increasing confidence in the physical representativeness ( Gachon and Dibike 2007).
